name: Architectural Attunement
effect: Perceive mystical resonance in a specific city
levels: (••••) *pre: Wits ••, Academics ••, Occult •, Occult Specialty: Sacred Geometry or Mystic Architecture

name: Area of Expertise
effect: increase a Mental Specialty to a +2

name: Atavism
effect: Use higher of Wits or Dexterity for Defense
levels: (•) *pre: Dexterity ••• or Wits •••, Intelligence •• or below

name: Barrister
effect: Can safely gauge how far Old Law limits can be pushed

name: Combat Awareness
effect: +2 to any situational awareness roll

name: Common Sense
effect: gives significant cautions or ideas

name: Crafter's Sense
effect: Common Sense related to a chosen Crafts Specialty

name: Danger Sense
effect: +2 to detect ambush

name: Dead Reckoning
effect: Gains 8-again when navigating in the Underworld; loses 10-again navigating above ground.

name: Direction Sense
effect: inate sense of direction

name: Eidetic Memory
effect: remember with ease, gain +2 to Intelligence + Composure to remember facts from large swaths of data

name: Emotional Detachment
effect: Ignores stress penalties equal to resolve

name: Encyclopedic Knowledge
effect: know obscure facts choose a topic and can make Intelligence + Wits rolls to gain facts related to it at any time

name: EOD
effect: reduce penalty for disarming unfamiliar explosives
levels: (••) *pre: Wits ••• or Dex •••, Crafts •••, Crafts Specialty of Demolitions

name: Entheogenic Synesthesia
effect: +1 to Perception when using psychoactive drugs

name: Eye for the Strange
effect: can roll Intelligence + Composure to determine if scene has a supernatural cause

name: Good Time Management
effect: cut time for non-magical Extended rolls by 1/4

name: Higher Calling
effect: +1 on Resolve rolls to resist coercion

name: Holistic Awareness
effect: Help others heal faster

name: Hypnotic Voice
effect: induce trance state
levels: (••••) *pre: Persuasion ••• or Science •••, Specialty of Hypnotherapy

name: Hypnosis
effect: Hypnotize subjects

name: Informative
effect: use specified Mental Skill in place of Expression

name: Interdisciplinary Specialty
effect: share Specialty between two Skills

name: Language
effect: +1/dot Language known [Errata changed to buy separate merit per Language]
levels: (• to •••) [Errata changed this to (•) with Expression to sound native]

name: Lucid Dreamer
effect: fight off intrusions into dreams

name: Make Do
effect: remove -1/dot penalty for shoddy tools

name: Meditative Mind
effect: no penalties to meditate

name: Multi-Lingual
effect: 2 languages per dot, conversationally

name: Murder Expert
effect: Strike a Killing Blow (WoD 168) against a single unsuspecting target

name: Mythologist
effect: Gains some insight into some of the Underworld's enigmas
levels: (•••) *pre: Occult •• with specialty in Underworld lore or similar

name: Psychic Resistance
effect: inhibit mental alteration by Psychics

name: Rational Explanation
effect: resist mental breakdown with Science or Academics

name: Scientist's Sense
effect: Common Sense related to Science

name: Supernatural Lore
effect: Know secret inner workings of a supernatural creature's capabilities
levels: (• to •••••) *mult, choose focus each time taken

name: Technophile
effect: Encyclopedic Knowledge in one topic

name: Telltale Murder
effect: After killing something, roll Intelligence + Medicine. •• version allows to 'taunt' those who would make Wits + Investigation rolls. ••• version allows to change the 'meaning' of a murder.

name: Tolerance for Biology
effect: +2 to to keep composed when shown scenes of violence or carnage

name: Trained Memory
effect: memorize information perfectly; roll to memorize for entire scene (i.e. everything a character could sense in a given moment) instead of specific information or sensory input

name: Trained Observer
effect: ignore penalties or gain Rote quality on Perception rolls

name: Vision
effect: use successes on Vision+Skill roll to aid an Extended Action
levels: (• to •••••) *pre: Intelligence or Wits or Resolve or Composure ••••

name: Well-Traveled
effect: 9-Again on Mental and Social rolls relating to foreign cultures

name: Whispers
effect: can purchase Dream and use it as Instant Action, at the cost of sanity

name: Ambidextrous
effect: remove off-hand penalty to attack

name: Armored Fighting
effect: reduce heavy armor penalties by 1 (••) or 2 (••••)

name: Athletics Dodge
effect: add Athletics rather than doubling Defense on Dodge

name: Brawling Dodge
effect: add Brawl rather than doubling Defense on Dodge

name: Demolisher
effect: can ignore 1 (•) or 2 (••) points of Durability when attempting to damage objects

name: Disarm
effect: if damage exceeds Dexterity, disarm

name: Direction Sense
effect: unfailing orientation

name: Entering Strike
effect: successful, defenseless Brawl strike adds bonus (= damage dealt) to subsequent grappling attack.

name: Equipped Grappling
effect: add size of blunt weapon (3 or less) to overpowering maneuver dice pool

name: Fighting Finesse
effect: sub Dexterity for Strength
levels: (••) *pre: Dex ••• and Weaponry •• (••) Pre: Dex 3, a Specialty in Weaponry or Brawl

name: Firearms Retention
effect: subtract Brawl dots from attempts to disarm by overpowering

name: Fast Reflexes
effect: +1/dot to Initiative

name: Fleet of Foot
effect: +1/dot to Speed

name: Fresh Start
effect: delay action into next round

name: Giant
effect: +1 Size

name: Ground and Pound
effect: perform Takedown/Throw, gain +2 to following unarmed strike.
levels: (••) *pre: Combination Blows, Boxing ••• or Aggressive Striking •••, Grappling ••

name: Gunslinger
effect: two gun attacks per round

name: Heavy Hands
effect: +1 damage to unarmed strikes

name: Iron Stamina
effect: eliminate fatigue/injury penalties

name: Iron Stomach
effect: eat even unpalatable cuisine

name: Natural Immunity
effect: +2 on Stamina rolls to resist illness

name: Outdoorsman
effect: negate environmental penalties to Survival

name: Perfect Stillness
effect: -2 to all rolls to visually detect character

name: Quick Draw
effect: draw and attack in one turn

name: Quick Healer
effect: 1/2 healing time

name: Shield-Bearer
effect: Only -1 to attack when using a shield instead of -2.

name: Steady Driver
effect: use Resolve+Drive rather than Dex

name: Strong Back
effect: +1 to lift or carry

name: Strong Lungs
effect: +2 on Stamina rolls to hold breath

name: Student of the Blade
effect: May use Fighting Style with all size-2 blades.

name: Stunt Driver
effect: drive and carry out another action

name: Stunt Rider
effect: ride and carry out another action

name: The Weapon at Hand
effect: Reflexive Wits + Weaponry roll for Improvised Weapon, instant action to wield, no penalty for being improvised

name: Toxin Resistance
effect: +2 on Stamina rolls to resist toxins

name: Weaponry Dodge
effect: add Weaponry rather than doubling Defense on Dodge

name: Weapons to Empty Hands
effect: use Brawl instead of Weaponry for maneuver-related attacks.
levels: (••) *pre: Dexterity •••, Brawl •••, Weaponry •••, Two Weapons •••• or Filipino Martial Arts •••• or Knife Fighting ••••

name: Wheelman
effect: gain 9-Again on Drive rolls

name: Allies
effect: Groups or organizations that can be called upon for favors, usually through particular individuals within those groups or organizations. Each dot represents overall power, resources and influence of that Ally. Allies are not minions: a favor for a favor is the basis of this merit. Allies may also be individuals at the GM's discretion.

name: Anonymity
effect: -1/dot to attempts to investigate character

name: Armory
effect: own an array of weapons and armor

name: Barfly
effect: find ways into bars and clubs

name: Bureaucratic Navigator
effect: +2 to navigate a bureaucratic system

name: Contacts
effect: Individuals that can be called upon for information -- at the GM's discretion, this can include groups or organizations, usually through particular individuals within those groups or organization. Each dot represents overall information-gathering ability, knowledge, accuracy and reliability of that Contact and any information they provide. Contacts are not minions: they may or may not readily supply information sought. Contacts are strictly channels through which information can be gained and serve no other purpose.

name: Decorated
effect: military awards for meritorious conduct (substitute military for another organization at GM's discretion)

name: Deep Rapport
effect: strong beneficial or harmful relationship with another character

name: Fame
effect: mortal acclaim, +1/dot to Socialize

name: Fence
effect: always find a way to buy and sell stolen goods

name: Friend
effect: Personal friends. Can be called upon for assistance, information and many other favours. Power represents the influence and abilities of the friend. Trust represents the closeness of the relationship and reliability of the Friend if things go sour or how much they've got the back of the character. Friends are not minions but they generally also have the characters best interests at heart: they are a fragile mix of Allies, Contacts, Retainer and Mentor.

name: Ingratiating Wanderer
effect: gain bonus to locate authority figures in local power structures

name: Inspiring
effect: help others regain Willpower

name: Luxury
effect: access to a lifestyle of wealth and luxury

name: Mentor
effect: Authoritative tutor or father figure. 1 dot represents specific knowledge, minimal resources and little influence in their field; 5 dots represent much hard-won and hard-learned knowledge, an abundance of resources and that they are a behemoth in their field. May or may not ultimately have the character's best interests at heart. Generally, the higher the dot rating, the more influence that the Mentor has over the character's life, directly or indirectly.

name: New Identity
effect: have a separate identity

name: Resources
effect: Disposable income. 1 dot represents a few hundred GBP; 5 represents millions reaching billions of GBP.

name: Retainer
effect: Trustworthy agent of the character. May be a personal assistant, personal bodyguard or even a deputy of the character. Retainers are generally loyal followers of the character but it is rare that they are an actual friend of the character -- their loyalty may also be only as strong as they are compensated by the character. Each dot represents the abilities of the character: 1 dot represents a weak, unskilled or otherwise lowly agent; 5 dots represents a very strong, highly skilled or otherwise outstanding agent who may even be supernatural.

name: Shadow Cult Initiation
effect: Membership in a shadow cult, with resultant benefits

name: Small Unit Tactics
effect: when conducting a tactical maneuver with squad, leader can spend Willpower to benefit entire group
levels: (•••) *pre: Manipulation ••• and Persuasion ••• with Leadership Specialty

name: Staff
effect: Employees -- may also be volunteers at GM's discretion. Represents general minions that the character commands and who ensure the running and managing of day-to-day operations for a character's businesses or organizations even when the character or any of their associates are not present or available to personally oversee the operations. Staff are not directly at the beck-and-call of the character like a Retainer but are given general responsibilities and are tasked instead. Staff are only as loyal as they are compensated. 1 dot represents the minimum manpower required for operations and generally unskilled and/or inexperienced manpower; 5 dots represent an abundance of manpower and generally highly talented and/or very experienced manpower

name: Status
effect: Reputation, social standing, rank or mixture of all in a group, organization or some other social order. 1 dot represents some small measure of recognition and/or official membership; 5 dots represents being held as a paragon within the social order and/or a senior leadership position within or the actual leader of the social order.

name: Striking Looks
effect: +1/+2 to influence with looks. Purely aesthetic -- Presence represents force of personality, magnetism and personal charisma. 2 dots represents above-average looks; 4 dots represents angelic or supermodel-esque looks.

name: Sworn Officer
effect: Membership within a law enforcement organization, granting respect from other organizations and powers such as arrest and use of force as typical for the area within your jurisdiction. The size and scope of said jurisdiction is dictated by merit rating, 1 dot represents a small rural town or country; 3 represents state-wide police; 4 represents a federal officer.

name: Trip Sitter
effect: help others resist side effects of drugs

name: Unobtrusive
effect: In studying a subject or a location, the character gains a +2 die bonus to escape notice as long as she’s engaged in some practical task at the same time. (Such tasks include driving, clearing a table, gardening, washing a car, performing a mundane desk job or any other such routine, monotonous drudgery.) +1 to the ghoul victim’s Resolve for purposes of resisting The Forgetful Mind (Dominate •••).

name: Difficult to Ride
effect: +2 against being affected by spirits or ghosts

name: Driver's Charm
effect: grant a vehicle bonuses once per day

name: Relic Creator
effect: make limited-use Relics

name: Relic
effect: own an empowered Relic

name: Relic Analyst
effect: +1 bonus to determine Relic's uses

name: Seventh Son of a Seventh Son
effect: gain bonuses if casting Hoodoo magical tradition spells, once per story, roll Wits + Comp, success equal bonus dice for any roll except spell casting

name: Additional Familiars
effect: have multiple spirit companions

name: Ancient Lands Awakening
effect: gain Rotes, mana from Virtue

name: Artifact
effect: treasure, imbued, refills own Mana

name: Atlantean Hesychia
effect: reach Astral Planes easier

name: Cartomancer
effect: gain benefits to magical tasks from Tarot draw
levels: (• to •••) *pre: Occult Specialty of Tarot, Wits •••

name: Daimon
effect: specialized Dream

name: Destiny
effect: bonus die pool, associated Bane penalty

name: Dream
effect: gain clues to questions

name: Enhanced Item
effect: super-effective tool

name: Extemporaneous Affinity
effect: +1/2/3 to casting Improvised Spells, represents extensive time with no formal training

name: Familiar
effect: Fetch/Animal spirit

name: Feral Mien
effect: +3 on Intimidation/Seduction rolls

name: Friend of Beasts
effect: +3 on Animal Ken, -2/0 on Socialize

name: Geomancer
effect: understand and alter Ley Line with construction

name: Gesture Lore
effect: modify Rote mundras between forms

name: Ghost Familiar
effect: Ghost bound as Familiar

name: Glyph Lore
effect: modify Rune aspects between forms

name: Goetic Familiar
effect: attach an embodiment of your Vice to yourself as a familiar

name: Guise of Death
effect: Coat a Soul Stone in blood to substitute for human sacrafice

name: High Speech
effect: allows use of Words of Power

name: Identity Anchor
effect: never risk sentience when shapechanged

name: Imbued Item
effect: item with magical ability

name: Law of Embodiment
effect: cast Rote while attacking

name: Long Shifting
effect: cast Shapechange as if +2 Life

name: Manifestation Machine
effect: +1/dot to Fetch's Manifest rolls

name: Master Exorcist
effect: gain +3 to end possessions

name: Myrmidon Oath Tongue
effect: language that commands the Proximi family known as Myrmidons

name: Occultation
effect: become lost to mortal society

name: Otherworldly Eyes
effect: +2 to see Shadow, -2 to see Fallen

name: Otherworldly Lore
effect: gain 9-Again when dealing with a particular breed of other-world creature

name: Potent Familiar
effect: gain bonus points to create Familiar

name: Predator’s Innocence
effect: be less bothered by natural cycle

name: Rote Specialty
effect: gain one Skill-based Rote Specialty / dot
levels: (• to •••) *pre: not a full member of any Order

name: Ritual Synergy
effect: cooperate on a spell even if not all participants can cast it
levels: (••• or •••••) *pre: Gnosis ••• or Gnosis •••••, Storyteller Option

name: Slayer
effect: May make Int+Occult check to reduce summoned creature's Defense against attacks

name: Sleepwalker Retainer
effect: faithful Sleepwalker assistant

name: Spirit Status
effect: remove -1/dot penalty for Spirit negotiations

name: Status (Consilium)
effect: Awakened society standing

name: Status (Order)
effect: Order standing, 1 dot is full member

name: Status (Seers of the Throne)
effect: Standing within the Seers, also allows increasing of Dream Merit. Having Dream and at least Status (•) requires taking of Flaw: Mystery Commands

name: Summoner's Soul
effect: gain bonuses when dealing with creatures of favored Realm

name: Supernal Anchor
effect: defeat Supernal creature in combat to create artificial Soul Stone

name: Supernal Companion
effect: Familiar from Supernal Realm

name: Thrall
effect: owned Soulstone, 3 tasks provided

name: Void Scourged
effect: gain bonuses when interacting with Acamoth and Gulmoth

name: Ancient Signs
effect: influence secret societies

name: Athenaeum
effect: gain two dots in Laboratory, Library or Scriptorium per dot

name: Graduate of Otranto
effect: gain bonus to cast curses
levels: (•••) *pre: Acanthus, Status (Mysterium) •, graduate of Scuola di Otranto

name: Masque
effect: alternate identities, various bonuses (see below)

name: Mystery Initiation
effect: gain bonuses related to Order

name: Oathbound
effect: bind Allegiance, Principle or Questing Oaths to your soul to gain benefits

name: Celestial Name
effect: aid in dealing with planetary spirits

name: Dreamland
effect: visit Dreamtime Libraries

name: Image of Perfection
effect: resist insanity with driving goal

name: Skald Cant
effect: aid in memory and spirit dealing

name: Astral Adept
effect: travel to Astral Planes anywhere

name: Magical Tradition
effect: gain bonus to Tradition Rotes
levels: (••) *pre: Occult ••, Academics or Occult Specialty in Tradition

name: Lu
effect: call on spirit court for service

name: Pawns
effect: lesser mages as allies

name: Bastion
effect: Changeling Motley Dream Fortress

name: Den
effect: Skinthief or Changing Breed

name: Haunt
effect: Sin-Eater

name: Haven
effect: Vampire

name: Hollow
effect: Changeling

name: Lair
effect: Promethean

name: Safehouse
effect: Hunter

name: Sanctum
effect: Mage

name: Temple
effect: Circle of the Crone

name: Archive
effect: Every dot is single topic, cuts study time.

name: Sanctum Materials
effect: increase strength of structure

name: Portable
effect: change location, personal only

name: Geomantic Nexus
effect: Fung Shui
levels: (• to •••••) Size and (• to •••) +1 attribute per dot

name: Guardian Retainer
effect: armed guard

name: Library
effect: 1/dot topics of research

name: Security
effect: +1 intiative against break-ins per dot.

name: Size
effect: • - 1-2 rooms, •• - 3-4 rooms, ••• - 5-8 rooms, •••• - 9-15 rooms, ••••• - Countless rooms

name: Location
effect: +1 bonus to hunting per dot for owner and invitees.

name: Occultation
effect: Penalizes attempts to find the Haven

name: Alchemical Lab
effect: resources to produce Gross Matter

name: Guardian Ghost
effect: bound Ghost

name: Guardian Spirit
effect: bound Spirit

name: Hallow
effect: upwelling of Mana

name: Sanctum Gauntlet
effect: +/- 1/dot Gauntlet

name: Scriptorium
effect: reduce cost to learn Rotes

name: Summoning Circle
effect: attuned circle to particular realm

name: Amenities
effect: How comfortable the Hollow is.

name: Doors
effect: Add doors in Hedge and on Earth.

name: Hob Kin
effect: Hobgoblins protect your Hollow.

name: Ritual Doorway
effect: Enter from anywhere on Earth. One way.

name: Wards
effect: Ability to hide and fortify Hollow

name: Workshop
effect: Space and tools for various crafts, 1/dot

name: Mobile Hollow
effect: More dots = further and faster, more control

name: Amenities
effect: How comfortable the Bastion is.

name: Battlements
effect: 10 points of damage per •, ranged attacks allowed

name: Arsenal
effect: Your bolthole stores a metaphysical arsenal of mundane weapons for you to withdraw once a session.

name: No Twilight
effect: The state of Twilight does not exist in your bolthole, and any entities in Twilight must Manifest when they enter.

name: Self-Destruct
effect: You can destroy your bolthole from anywhere, dealing (Bolthole) lethal damage and giving those within one turn to escape before they are trapped beyond spacetime.

name: Cover-Linked
effect: Your bolthole is so strongly linked to a specific Cover that when you are not using that Cover, the bolthole ceases to exist and those within simply vanish.

name: Trap Door
effect: When you are in your bolthole, no one else can find the physical entrance, though it still remains in Twilight.

name: Easy Access
effect: Spend a point of Aether to redesignate a new door into and out of your bolthole.

name: Cant Savvy
levels: (··) Pre: Intelligence ·· and Politics · or Occult · or Streetwise ·

name: Connections
levels: (· to ·····) Pre: Presence ·· and Politics ·· or Streetwise ···

name: Feeding Ground
levels: (· to ·····) Pre: Fealty Flaw (for ···· and ····· only)

name: Tenant
levels: (· to ·····) Pre: Domain Size per merit, Fealty Flaw

name: Vassal
levels: (· to ·····) Pre: Domain Size per merit, Fealty Flaw

name: Acute Senses

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Add Blood Potency to all rolls involving the kindred's senses. This includes rolls to remember sensory details.

name: Altar

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Grants bonuses to Crúac rituals performed before the altar, and allows characters without dots in Crúac to participate in rituals and add dice bonuses.

name: Annointed

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Once per chapter, gain the ability to make a Presence+Expression roll to subject listeners to the Raptured condition by way of fiery preaching.

name: Atrocious

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Any rolls involving the Monstrous beast gain the 8-again quality.

name: Attache

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Retainers get any combination of the following merits equal to the Kindred's dots in Invictus Status; Contacts, Resources, and Safe Place.

name: Bad Breeding
effect: May gain a social bonus up to the dot rating amongst those who would underestimate the Kindred due to their background. Also, Kindred from " low society " respect your background and Kindred from " high society " shun you.
levels: (• to •••) *pre: Does not have Good Breeding

name: Bloodhound

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Can detect blood, track by blood, or determine details of blood through scent alone.

name: Cacophony Listener
effect: Familiarity and comprehension of many subtle methods of communique used by Kindred.

name: Cacophony Saavy

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: At one dot, spot and identify all cacophony messages. Two dots allows one to familiarize themselves with new kindred within a week. Three dots means the character is a hub of local politics, with several benefits.

name: Carthian Pull

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Gain temporary Allies, Contacts, Haven, and Herd merits equal to Carthian Status.

name: Claws of the Unholy

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: When using claws granted by Unnatural Aspect, the weapon modifier becomes +0A and ignore all armor not granted by Resilience. Only usable while frenzied or riding the wave.

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

name: Cutthroat

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Any rolls involving the Competitive beast gain the 8-again quality.

name: Distant Sympathy
effect: No longer limited when attempting to sense another through Blood Sympathy; this is only sensory, and does not allow use of disciplines over long distances.

name: Distinguished Palate

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Consider any Taste of Blood roll to be an exceptional success with only a single success.

name: Doll Face
effect: Awaken from sleep each night automatically groomed.

name: Dream Visions
effect: Once per night, when first meeting a new person or finding a new place, roll blood potency, and on success may ask one question about them.

name: Dynastic Membership

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Allows several useful bonuses by associating the Kindred in question with elder and more powerful vampires of higher standing, or, at the highest level, as head of a Dynasty.

name: Enticing

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: All rolls involving the Seductive beast gain the 8-again quality.

name: Feeding Grounds

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Effective places to hunt, whether officially sanctioned or not. Add dots in this merit to any hunting rolls, and to starting vitae rolls. In addition, add the dot rating to any predatory aura conflicts in the territory.

name: Friends in High Places

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Each month, gain a number of favors (or, using the new social system, 'doors') that can be automatically opened, so long as the favor being asked is within an organization's purview.

name: Ghost Eater
effect: Can feed on ghostly Essence through their anchors; overuse can result in the loss of the ability to feed on blood.
levels: (•••) *pre: Has learned to feed on ghosts in the Underworld

name: Good Breeding
effect: May gain a social bonus up to the dot rating amongst those who respect your background. Also, Kindred from " high society " respect your background and Kindred from " low society " shun you.
levels: (• to •••) *pre: Does not have Bad Breeding

name: Haunted Channel
effect: Ghosts gain +1 bonus per dot

name: Haunted Hand
effect: The character gains a +1 bonus per dot in all interactions with a ghost, such as exorcism or communication. Does not apply to the ghost's anchor.

name: Herd
effect: Possession of a faithful group of kine upon which one can easily feed - each week, gain a number of Vitae equal to twice this merit's rating. This requires no rolls, only a quick interlude.

name: Honey Trap

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Your blood not only bonds, but invigorates. When a vampire tastes your character's Vitae, they regain a point of Willpower. If this results in a new bond, or increases an existing bond, they also gain an experience.

name: Inherited Ghoul
effect: Reflects a ghoul who has worked with previous masters, and may possess vital information relating to them.

name: Inherited Resistance
effect: Gains a bonus to resist Animalism and Dominate Disciplines from other Ventrue; four dot variant provides resistance from all clans

name: Inhuman Resistance
effect: Gains a bonus to resist Dominate and Majesty, but a weakness to powers from the Animalism Discipline.

name: Invested

sources.sourceBook: Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle

effect: Divide the Kindred's Invictus Status dots between Herd, Mentor, Resources, and Retainer merits. These can add to existing merit dots or exist on their own. Losing status forfeits the dots as well.

name: Kindred Medium
effect: Gains a special connection with a spirit, and the ability to see and interact with it, along with the ability to feel the presence of other spirits. Two dots if bought at character creation, four dots otherwise.

name: Lordly Palette
effect: May discern information about a subject through the consumption of their blood.

name: Noble Heritage
effect: A Roman citizen in noble standing, grants a bonus to Presence or Manipulation rolls to influence citizens who are aware of one's status, but a penalty if tagged as a criminal or a disgrace.

name: Occultation
effect: Penalizes attempts to find the character, even with Auspex; grants a bonus to Obfuscate and a penalty to Majesty.

name: Of Rose and Thorn
effect: Gain the ability to use Animalism powers on plants

name: Regnant
effect: Reflects a healthy relationship with one's keeper.

name: Remnant of Clarity
effect: Keep a year of memory completely clearly through the Fog of Ages, each dot adds dice to rolls to remember it.

name: Pack Blooded
effect: Gain significant combat bonuses when nearby other coterie mates who share this merit, but experience a penalty to degeneration in their presence as well.

name: Requiem Diary
effect: Represents a written record of unlife, allowing 9-again on rolls to research one's own past.

name: Patron
effect: Be owed favors or debts by one or more individuals, who is expected to do whatever is necessary to pay it off quickly.

name: Savage Kenning
effect: Gain a bonus to interactions with a specific type of animals.
levels: (•••) *pre: Gangrel, Animalism • or Animal Ken • (CO only)

name: Social Chameleon
effect: Gains a bonus to all social rolls within a specified subculture.

name: Swarm Mind
effect: Transform into a swarm of small animals, but suffer mental derangement for a time after reforming.

name: Taste of the Strange
effect: Allows one to regain Vitae from drinking the blood of other supernatural creatures; may be taken up to three times.

name: Tenacious Consciousness
effect: Gain a +2 bonus to awaken from torpor or daytime slumber due to external threats.

name: Tomb
effect: Add dots in Tomb to Haven Security for the purposes of repelling intrusion.

name: True Worm
effect: Can stay awake through the day, functioning at 1/2 max speed. Must be 30 feet or more underground, in tunnels never touched by the sun. Increases damage given by sunlight by +1.

name: Undead Menses
effect: Experience menstruation, which grants a variety of special powers.

name: Unliving Anchor
effect: The Nosferatu becomes an anchor for a ghost, whose numina equals the purchased dots. The ghost acts as a retainer, but occasionally asks favors, losing numina if they are not carried out.

name: Unyeilding Mask
effect: Permanently affixes a mask to the face. At •••, grants a +2 to resist mental and social Disciplines. At ••••, it also grants +1 to any appropriate Social skill.

name: Vice over Virtue
effect: Reverse how one regains Willpower through Vice and Virtue; Vice returns all spent Willpower, and Virtue returns a single point.

name: Vitae Connoisseur
effect: Choose a specific kind of favored prey (blondes, terrified victims, etc.) and regain a point of Willpower. This only works once a night.

name: Voyeur
effect: Once per session, regain Willpower as someone else indulges their vice. Three dots requires the Daeva to act as a tempter, with five dots simply observation will suffice.

name: Zeal
effect: Gain a +1 bonus to all social rolls where one's cause might prove helpful. Substitute Resolve for a lower attribute once per chapter.

name: Carthian Lawyer
effect: Character is adept at twisting Carthian Law for their own purposes.

name: Carthian Pull
effect: Once per month, may substitute Carthian Pull dots for Contacts, Haven, Herd, or Resources.

name: Coder Clique
effect: Gains 9-Again on Computer rolls

name: Current Events Circle
effect: Gains 9-Again on Politics rolls

name: Debate Club
effect: Gains 9-Again on Persuasion rolls

name: Encounter Group
effect: Gains 9-Again on Empathy rolls

name: Lab Section
effect: Gains 9-Again on Medicine rolls

name: Night Doctor Surgery
effect: Perform surgery to convert lethal to bashing damage, or aggravated to lethal

name: Study Group
effect: Gains 9-Again on Academics rolls

name: Theater Society
effect: Gains 9-Again on Expression rolls

name: The Right Bar
effect: Gains 9-Again on Streetwise rolls

name: House Membership
effect: Reflects membership in a dynastic house, granting social bonuses equal to merit dots when interacting with others of the House.

name: Speaker for the Eclipsed
effect: May telepathically commune with a torpid fellow, at a distance of up to five miles per dot in this merit.

name: Tap of the Torpid Mind
effect: May briefly use the skill or discipline of the target of Speaker for the Eclipsed
levels: (• to •••••) *pre: Vampire, House Membership •••, Speaker for the Eclipsed •

name: Torpor Connection
effect: Commune with a specific torpid fellow.

name: Virtue's Twin
effect: Torpor duration uses the Humanity of the highest house member with this merit.

name: Will of the Dynasty
effect: Any attempts to compel the character with this merit to act against their house is resisted as if they had spent a willpower point.

name: Crucible Ritual
effect: Can make use of a 'crucible', a beneficial type of Wyrm's Nest. Can gain a discount to learn a coil or other benefits.

name: Fontal Ritual
effect: Can make use of Wyrm's Nests known as " wellheads " or " fontal nests "; can learn fontal rituals and gains bonuses to find fontal nests.

name: Geomantic Nexus
effect: Has a specially prepared area which provides bonuses to specific actions within; similar to and can overlap with the Haven merit.
levels: (• to ••••• and • to •••; special) *pre: Occult ••• and Wits ••

name: Mind of the Devouring Worm
effect: As Eidetic Memory, but can be purchased after character creation.

name: Mind of the Unblinking Serpent
effect: Can determine when Obsfucate or Dominate have been used on the character.

name: Mind of the Inscrutable Hydra
effect: Character can switch their mind to a state that grants a penalty to Intelligence tests, but all effects that attempt to read their mind are resisted or contested as if a Willpower point had been spent.

name: Ancestral Vessel
effect: Allows the channeling of a specific ancestor spirit, granting skill bonuses or other wisdom.

name: Animal Magnetism
effect: Reduces penalty from Primal Urge for purposes of seduction, but penalizes all social rolls with those not attracted to you

name: Auspice Blessing
effect: When auspice moon is visible overhead, gain a bonus to a select affinity skill

name: Beginner's Luck
effect: Only -1 for Untrained Mental Skills. Dramatic failure results in losing a point of Willpower.

name: Chain Breaker
effect: Frees a spirit from a bound fetish.

name: Ephemeral Reckoning
effect: Two dot version can sense the resonance of an area, four dot can sense the resonance of a source of Essence

name: Eyrie
effect: +2 Perception within your territory. +1 to ranged attack pools within the territory

name: Far-Runner's Intuition
effect: May roll Wits + Streetice or Wits+Survival to find a given packmate in the city or the wild, respectively along with other details.

name: Fetish
effect: An item containing a bound spirit which has a specific, useful benefit.

name: Local
effect: +1 to social rolls dealing with humans within the werewolfs territory. Humans living in the territory get +1 effective willpower for Lunacy caused by the werewolf with this merit.

name: Mercy of Luna
effect: May spend a point of Willpower to reduce Primal Urge Social penalties by Cunning score to a max of of 0.

name: Metabolic Control
effect: May suppress regeneration or other physical advantages of being a werewolf in order to hide

name: Moon Centered
effect: During auspice moon gain a bonus to rolls to stay in war form, but suffer a penalty to Composure checks until the first such transformation is done in a lunar cycle.

name: Naturally Deceptive
effect: By spending a point of Willpower on a Larceny, Stealth ,or Subterfuge the Irraka may add their Cunning score instead of +3.

name: Nimble Defender
effect: +1 Defense within your territory. +1 to Athletics to move around your territory.

name: Pathfinder's Blessing
effect: The Irraka rolls 4 additional dice for Pathfinder's Sense instead of the normal 2.

name: Predator’s Gaze
effect: Make people slightly uncomfortable, making them more inclined to do what you say or do anything to make you go away.

name: Prophet's Voice
effect: Similar to Dream merit; can gain symbolic but prophetic visions once per story

name: Scout
effect: +1 perception and Stealth in another pack's territory, as long as you are not attacked or interfered with.

name: Secret Paths
effect: +2 stealth within one's territory. A hiding place can be created in a turn which provides a further +2 and 1 point of cover.

name: Short Cuts
effect: Werewolves with this merit can find alternate paths around obstacles in their territory without losing any time.

name: Staunch Defender
effect: +1 to attack pools with claws and teeth against invaders of your territory. Drawback: -1 to Death Rage while defending your territory

name: Strong Bloodline
effect: Increases effective Purity renown for some social purposes.

name: Trained Senses
effect: May ignore up to two dice of penalties to perception rolls. By spending a point of Willpower the Werewolf may ignore a penalty of any size for a perception roll.

name: Territorial Familiarity
effect: +2 to Survival within region of territory. At one dot, this territory is a few city blocks. Three dots, it is several miles worth of territory. Werewolves get the full effect at 2 dots.

name: Vicious Attacker
effect: +1 to attack pools against werewolves in their territory.

name: Acid Stomach
effect: digest any ingested substance, instead of purely organic

name: Azothic Object
effect: own a Pyros-infused object

name: Companion
effect: Spirit companion follows and aids you

name: Device
effect: internal mechanism

name: Elpis
effect: gain insight into Milestones

name: Famous Face
effect: influence those your corpse used to know

name: Fresh Corpse
effect: ignore untrained physical penalties

name: Good Brain
effect: ignore untrained mental penalties

name: Hideous Anyway
effect: improves intimidation, but damages other social rolls

name: Incorruptible
effect: bonus on humanity rolls when activating Pandoran transmutations

name: Pilgrim
effect: when telling the story of your Pilgrimage, gain Willpower

name: Pilgrim
effect: Gain more Vitriol from Milestones

name: Repute
effect: Status amongst Prometheans

name: Residual Memory
effect: have clearer memories of your past life

name: Shabti
effect: Pyros-infused statue companion

name: Shepherd
effect: Help others gain Vitriol from Milestones

name: Unpalatable Aura
effect: Pandorans attack other Prometheans for food first

name: Weatherproof
effect: never be affected by environmental conditions

name: Endowments
effect: Grants access to Endowments

name: Favored Weapon
effect: User selects a specific weapon he has used in combat upholding the vigil. As long as the weapon is being used or is nearby, in and out combat, the user gains +2 to Resolve+Composure

name: Indomitable
effect: Gain dots to all rolls to resist any form of suggestion, mundane or supernatural.

name: Kin
effect: Character is related to werewolves. +3 to resist Lunacy, +2 to social dealing with werewolves, Unseen sense relating to werewolves. -1 to Social rolls dealing with normal humans. Also viewed as breeding stock by werewolves.

name: Language: ConLang
effect: Military sign language. +1 to all Tactic rolls for each cell member who has this Merit (minimum two). Each cell member who lacks it takes a -1 penalty instead.

name: Natural Medium
effect: Unseen Sense relating to spirits, understand spirit language, for 1 point of Willpower, can " speak " to spirits. Immune to possession by spirits unless they voluntarily allow it,but may suffer from Flaw: Nightmares.

name: Null
effect: +1 to Intimidation vs. Spirits. Penalties to spirits materializing around character. -2 to Social rolls dealing with werewolves and spirits.

name: Professional Training
effect: Reflects job experiences, and natural prowess at the talents important to character's line of work.

name: Status, Compact or Conspiracy
effect: Character holds membership in a hunter compact (Tier 2) or Conspiracy (Tier 3)

name: Torture Suite
effect: a private space that adds to Intimidation rolls for interrogations.

name: Unbondable
effect: It takes twice as many drinks of Vitae to blood bond you (six instead of three).

name: Ceremony
effect: Gain Number of Ceremonies Based on Number of Dots Held

name: Death-Touched
effect: Gain a one or two die bonus to non-hostile rolls to interact with ghosts in the Underworld; for an additional merit dot this applies to ghosts anywhere.

name: Memento
effect: Item with various bonuses

name: Encylopedic Knowledge*
effect: Modified from the mortal merit - this is much more limited in scope, and only references information from the past.

name: Language*
effect: As well as speaking Iremite Egyptian, the Mummy learns two languages at chargen, and additional languages cost 1xp.

name: Cult
effect: This is detailed in it's own chapter.

name: Enigma
effect: Acts similarly to the Occult background - whenever someone makes a roll to learn about, track, or find information regarding the Mummy, he takes a penalty equal to the Mummy's Enigma rating.

name: Guild Status
effect: Status in the five guilds of Irem. One dot represents Apprentices, where two to four dots represent Journeymen. Five dots represent a guildmaster. A Mummy adds his dots of Guild status to interactions with her guild.

name: Relic
effect: Offers the use of Relics; One to three dots provides single relics of increasing dot strength, four dots provides either a four-dot or a three dot and a one dot, and five dots follows the same pattern; either a five dot relic or a three dot and a two dot relic.

name: Advance Form
effect: Have one less Modification or Technology, but one more Propulsion or Process.

name: Bolthole
effect: Your Cover's Infrastructure contains a time-static warded safehole to duck into. Dots in Bolthole are used to purchase Bolthole aspects below.

name: Consummate Professional (Agenda)
effect: You can resolve an Agenda Condition twice rather than once per session.

name: Cultists
effect: You have a cult loyal to your demonic identity. More dots purchase more dedicated and loyal cultists, or at five dots, supernaturally endowed cultists.

name: Efficient Dealer
effect: Ignore one level of asset on the Demon's side when creating a pact.

name: Electromagnetic Linguistics
effect: Can speak and understand machine code. Includes instinctively understanding what computer code does or 'hearing' text messages as they're transmitted.

name: High Tolerance
effect: Can graft one gadget containing a Demon Form ability without losing access to an existing one. One dot allows for Modification or Technology, Two dots allows for Propulsion or Process.

name: Living the Lie
effect: Allows you to give Covers a Virtue and Vice and regain willpower using them or the Demon's own Virtue and Vice.

name: Monkeywrencher
effect: R Gain the ability to negate Embeds that match the Demon's Cipher (with known Keys) or Incarnation. Spend an Aether and roll Resolve + Primum, each success subtracting from the Embed user's success. Can also counter Numina from Angels.

name: Multiple Agendas
effect: You have dedicated yourself to two Agendas.

name: Resonance Aware
effect: Add the dots in Resonance Awareness to Primum when determining the range of sensing Aether.

name: Resonance Sensitivity
effect: Activating the ability to detect Aether does not cost Aether. The ability to detect Aether can be turn on and off reflexively and you can automatically detect any nearby Aether.

name: Suborned Infrastructure
effect: You have taken over and rigged an instance of God-Machine Infrastructure to produce Aether. Like all Infrastructure, it has a linchpin.

name: Subsumed Gadget
effect: Integrate a Gadget into your Demonic form so it can be healed as if a part of their body and can be activated by concentrating. However, it cannot be hidden when Demonic Form is exposed.

name: Sympathetic Stigmatic
effect: Have a sympathetic friend who understands the Demon's plight. Gain +2 on all rolls to find a Key if the Sympathetic Stigmatic is present. Additionally, gain 9-again on all rolls to use an Interlock that has been unlocked in that Stigmatic's presence. The Stigmatic bears no obvious Stigmata, but suffers the same injury that the Demon does. Comes with the equivalent Stigmatic merit " Sympathetic Demon ".

name: Tattooed Gadget
effect: Can use your own body as hardware for Embedded Gadget creation. Tattooed Gadgets cannot be lost, stolen, destroyed or overclocked and do not need triggers for activation.

name: Terrible Form (Style)
effect: Body Modification: Your demonic form has an extra Modification.

name: Technological Advancement: Your demonic form has an extra Technology.
Jet Propulsion: Your demonic form has an extra Propulsion.
Dual Processors: Your demonic form has an extra Process.
Versatile Transformation
effect: When you partially transform, it costs one Aether for every two form abilities manifested. Manifesting extra abilities is optional.

name: Age Reversal
effect: Your Changeling begins to age backwards.

name: Arcadian Body
effect: Bring an attribute to a maximum of +6 , 5th dot only costs one dot at character creation.

name: Arcadian Metabolism
effect: Greater healing when eating Goblin Fruits, but suffer malnutrition without one Fruit per week.

name: Brownie's Boon
effect: You complete mundane tasks in half the time that it would take others! Well, except you can't be watched while you do it. You can spend a glamour to half this time again. And again. And a gain. Though, this tops out at being able to finish something in 1/16th the time.

name: Charmed Life
effect: Reroll when dealt aggravated damage or would otherwise be killed.

name: Court Goodwill
effect: Develop favor with members of a Court. Ensorcelled mortals can take this merit.

name: Devotee
effect: You have a group of loyal, but broken followers.

name: Disenchanting Kiss
effect: With high Clarity, you have a kiss that cancels mind and emotional controll

name: Dual Kith
effect: Your character possesses two or more kiths, and by proxy the blessing that comes with it.

name: Dual Kith
effect: Your character possesses two or more kiths, and by proxy the blessing that comes with it.

name: Enchanting Performance
effect: Reduce negative situation modifiers to Expression or Persuasion equal to your wyrd. Spending a point of Glamour the performance becomes rote, and if successful, it inspires an emotion appropriate to performance.

name: Fae Mount
effect: You own a Hobgoblin/Token/Otherwise magical mount.

name: Faerie Favor
effect: You possess a token, which, when broken, will summon your Keeper, who owes you a single favor.

name: Faerie Healing
effect: Capable of using Goblin Fruits to restore health to others. Does not apply to the dead (Ghosts, Vampires)

name: Fighting Style Dream Combat
effect: Abilities for fighting while in a dream. Look under the Styles Merits page for more information.

name: Fighting Style Hedge Duelist
effect: Abilities to use in a formal duel while in the Hedge. Look under the Styles Merits page for more information.

name: Gentrified Bearing
effect: You look a bit like the True Fae, and can fool Hobgoblins and Gentry at a distance.

name: Goblin Merchant
effect: Sell at Goblin Market without being price-gouged and while protected by Market Law

name: Goblin Vow
effect: Can make pledges with one Wyrd-purview/dot; no sanction and boon and task must be related to purview

name: Harvest
effect: A list of your consistent sources of Glamour. Examples include: Emotion, Dreaming, Oaths, Hedge Fruit

name: Hedge Gate Sense
effect: Sensitivity to established Hedge Gates, lower time spent finding such a gate cut by half, granted a reflexive roll when near one.

name: Hedgebeast Companion
effect: Intelligent Hobgoblin familiars who act as animal retainers. The more dots you have, the stronger the Hobgoblin is.

name: Hidden Life
effect: Seeking information about your character takes a penalty, including remembering contact or physical details.
prerequistes: Fame 0, Wyrd equal to dots in Hidden Life

name: Hob Kin
effect: Feel like family to Hobs, making it easier to make fair deals with them.

name: Hobgoblin Trainer
effect: Ability (and rules) for temporarily training Hobgoblins.

name: Hollow
effect: House for changelings that is between the hedge and the real world.

name: Lethal Mien
effect: A part of the body becomes a weapon, and granted a damage bonus. This can stack with Blessings.

name: Long of Days
effect: When determining maximum age, the Changeling is treated as if her Wyrd is +4. For information on aging, see CtL p. 174 - 175.

name: Mantle
effect: Membership in a court, benefits in the form of bonuses to social interaction, Contracts and Blessing. The first dot for free.

name: Manymask
effect: The Changeling possesses multiple masks (One per dot) and can change them. The masks do not change your size and gender.

name: Market Familiarity
effect: Locate and attend Goblin Markets.

name: Market Sense
effect: +3 bonus to determine if being cheated in deals.

name: Market Stall
effect: Own a stall where you can store goods and be able to extract and store abstractions.

name: New Identity
effect: The quality of legal (Or illegal) documentation supporting your new identity. This merit can be taken by mortals or other supernaturals as well.

name: Perfect Stillness
effect: The Changeling is capable of standing absolutely still, and all rolls to notice or locate take -2.

name: Pledgesmith
effect: Your character is known for having a way with words. Gain +1 for every merit dot when discussing Pledges.

name: Prophet Circle
effect: Grants ensorcelled mortals to receive Prophetic dreams. Costs 1 glamour and a Wits + Occult roll.

name: Rigid Mask
effect: Hide your emotions very well, even from lie detectors and such.

name: Second-Hand Skills
effect: Gain bonus equal to dots to three skills once per Chapter.

name: Shared Sleep
effect: Need only 4 hours sleep as long as you spends 6 hours in each of your personalities.
prerequistes: Functional Multiple Personalities or Multiple Personality Disorder

name: Siren Song
effect: While speaking, everyone within earshot takes a -2 penalty to all actions.

name: Slave
effect: Supernatural servant purchased at Market.

name: Soul Sense
effect: Always know the direction and distance to your Fetch, its moods and emotions, and a +2 to social rolls when interacting. Take penalties when it is injured or killed.

name: Sublime
effect: The Changeling's mein becomes transcendental, and mortals become bewitched, limiting their actions. Changelings must roll Resolve + Composure or be bewitched.

name: Narrative Master
effect: Spend Glamour to increase Talecrafting rolls.

name: Token
effect: Own a once mundane charm turned magical from its time in the Hedge or Arcadia. You may not use this merit to obtain Legendary Tokens (••••• or more). See the list here]].

name: Token Maker
effect: Through extended actions and spending Glamour a Changeling may create a Token at 25 successes per level.

name: Tokenmaster
effect: Being in constant touch with objects turns them into Tokens. See the list here]].

name: Unseen Sense, Talecrafting
effect: Sense when the an opportunity to set up a Hook comes up.

name: Visionary Dreams
effect: Your character receives Prophetic Dreams. Costs 1 Willpower point and a Intelligence + Wits roll.

name: Wholesale Wares
effect: Once per chapter, reduce the cost of an item by dots in the Merit so long as intent is to resell.

name: Wisdom of Dreams
effect: A successful Wits + Composure leads to borrowing a skill specialty or language for one day from a known mortals dreams

name: Wyrdskill
effect: Gain a free skill specialty in one field every time you grow in Wyrd. Developing other skills may cost more.

name: Kiss of Life
effect: The Leechfinger can store stolen health and use it to heal himself or others.

name: Subtle Liquer
effect: When the Brewer uses his blessing, the merit makes the fermented drink unrecognizable as alcoholic.

name: Outsider Fetish
effect: Begin play with a talen or fetish. Must be instructed on the usage by a Werewolf. List of Talens and Fetishs.
levels: (• to •••) *pre: The Lord Sages of the Unknown Reaches

name: Bloodied Ground
effect: The milestone is achieved on the human side of an open gateway (The Hedge must be seen). Reach the spot where the Fetch died easier.

name: Broken Mirror
effect: The milestone is achieved when done personally. Once per story, the Changeling can activate the merit to gain +3 to any roll.

name: Cuckoo's Egg
effect: The milestone is achieved with no witnesses, even animals. Receive an item that lets you play the part of the fetch. Can be stolen and used to impersonate the Changeling.

name: False Heart
effect: The milestone is achieved. A fist-sized object that was the fetches heart is taken, which can be used as Glamour reserves. Usable only by the owner.

name: Fetchbane
effect: The milestone is achieved with a single weapon not made of Cold Iron. The weapon does lethal damage (Or +2 if lethal) when infused with Glamour. Take penalties for using it in self-defense.

name: Shared Guilt
effect: The milestone is achieved when every member of a motley gets at least one hit into a Fetch, and is applied to every member. When any member is rolling for degeneration, the motley can activate this merit to have every member roll a degeneration check. If there is even one success, then it counts as a sucess for everyone.

name: Bean Buyer
effect: Once per story, after being tricked, spend a glamour to gain a significant advantage.

name: Cloistered Spinne
effect: Do an instant Action to turn trash into something valuable.

name: Cowherd and Weaver
effect: Gain some knowledge of circumstance when forcibly seperated from your lover, and your lover escapes.

name: Evil Stepsister
effect: Spend a Glamour whilst being cruel to a subordinate to get something that will help you in the future.

name: Fair Prince
effect: You are loved by almost all the courts, and receive a bonus for dealing with non-fae.

name: Fisher King
effect: When at full health, all Social Merits act as though you have them twice over (Not doubled).

name: Mobled Queen
effect: Massive bonuses when activating a Court Contract, and a bonus when harvest a Court Emotion.

name: Monkey Heart
effect: +5 to notice traps and avoid being suprised by an adversary for a second time after.

name: Mortal Enemy
effect: Get extra dice when dealing with your enemy, as well as other bonuses.

name: Star-Crossed Lover
effect: Spending a Willpower point when working to protect or save your love is an automatic success and regain a point of Willpower per scene spent protecting her.

name: Enchanted Mortal
effect: Character is treated as if permanently Ensorcelled.

name: No Seeming
effect: Character is treated as if she has no kith or seeming, therefore no curse or blessing. Gains +1 to all rolls involving clarity loss or gaining a derangement.

name: Seeming
effect: Character possesses a seeming, and has the associated blessing and curse. -1 to rolls to avoid derangement.

name: Fae Pet
effect: Similar to Retainer, grants the Fey an animal companion that is willing to die for its master. Any pet that dies is replaced within 24 hours.

name: Fair Haven
effect: Designated area in the real world where the Fey can stay without being poisoned by reality.
